conclusion: Two spherical oil droplets, A and B, are located on the same vertical line and fall with a uniform velocity through a distance of h1 within time t.
A voltage U is applied across the two plates with the upper plate connected to the positive terminal.
The upper plate has a small hole in the center.
Air resistance is given by f = k m^(1/3)v and gravity is mg = m g.
Equation of motion for droplet A: mg = m dv/dt, leading to dv = g dt.
Equation of motion for droplet B: mg - f = m dv/dt, leading to dv = g dt - f/m dt.
